page.title: 03Housing in Penryn
page.content: The streets are adorned with old and pleasant houses and shops dating from the{16th}and early{17th}centuries,{ {Broad Street}in particular is flanked by state hung,painted or granite houses.{Lower Street}and {Higher {Street}are at different levels so that the shops are of individual character.In the centre of this busy shopping street is the{Town Hall}a long,and narrow building dating from{ {1825.} As the town has grown, its newer residential areas have spread northwards , and westwards rather than towards neighbouring{Falmouth.Penryn} has an equable climate;with hard winter frost, and snow rarely seen. The town contains its own{Infant, {Junior,}and{ Comprehensive Schools.}It also enjoys many sporting facilities. { }
